snippet: Ten years after a scandal forced the nation’s Catholic bishops to adopt policies for combating sexual abuse, the prelates heard a generally positive assessment of their progress.
abstract: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops conduct their annual meeting, delivering a generally positive assessment of their ten-year effort to combat sexual abuse; bishops defend their fight against the Obama administration's policy on birth control coverage, which some had criticized as aligning the church too closely with the Republican Party.
lead_paragraph: Ten years after a scandal forced the nation’s Catholic bishops to adopt policies for combating sexual abuse, the prelates heard a generally positive assessment of their progress.

headline.seo: Catholic Bishops Vow to Press On Against Obama Policies
headline.main: Bishops Defend Fight Against Obama’s Policy on Birth Control Coverage
headline.print_headline: Bishops Defend Fight Against Obama’s Policy on Birth Control Coverage

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
